caption: Not much to be said from this experience of placing a phone order and picking it up - my lab rib flatbread was tasty.
Good Burgers

Really cute place!  They have a hibiscus margarita that I had to order twice and their hummus is great.  My fiancé and I came for the weekend and made a second stop before we left.  We tried the pastrami cuban and the pastrami reuben.  Both of them were tasty with a lot of flavor.
Great staff. Good food. Fun location.
We visited this cute restaurant/bar for Happy Hour back in October and the happy hours deals were pretty good, good customer service, and a beautiful atmosphere inside.
Nice place. I enjoyed the happy hour beers. Cool place to hang out for some drinks and food.
Food is always great. Excellent service. Good Covid protocols. Not very crowded. They need to stay in business, please go!!
Ate outside on a cool November afternoon, they lit the patio heaters and we had hummus and a Reuben and a mozzarella tomato flatbread. All very tasty and good service.
Food was excellent and great service. Prices are reasonable.
Delicious food and great ambiance
Great service, drinks, and food!
I work here! Come by and have some great food 😋
Carving Room's Pastrami Cuban is best meal in DC for $16 or less.
Great food & service.
I love this place so much. The food and management are both incredible. I honestly come here 2-3 times a week. Perfect spot for happy hour, brunch or just to come for a drink and a quick bite!
Quiet place for quick luncheon
Nice staff and lots of meat. Not a steak place. The flat bread did not quite have the flavor I was hoping for. Prices are friendly.
Great cocktails and wine collection. The lamb kofta and whipped housemade ricotta are must haves
In super-pretentious hipster NoMa, this place fits right in. That being said, I completely enjoyed my beer and food. Quite good!

Too pricey to not get good service. I went with some friends for the $19.99 bottomless mimosa special... As they were bringing out all of our food, they forgot one of my friends meals so we all had to wait an extra 20 min to eat before they brought her food. The servers clearly did not want to refill our mimosa glasses, we would have to ask 3-4 times for a refill before we would get one, which kind of defeats the purpose of "bottomless." There was no rush for assistance. I wish this was due to them being busy but we were one of 3 other groups. I really wanted to love this place because of the location but it's too expensive to not have a good experience.

The food is on point. The flavors are great. The service was very good, though oir food could have  come a bit faster. The decor and vibe are very dc urban chic, an enjoyable aesthetic.  Located in dc and near a metro stop the location is good. The prices are a bit higher than average but worth it. I definately reccomend anything on the flatbread menu.  Traveler and Adventurer - IG @brian.dent
Classy bar restaurant. Delicious food and courteous servers.

Caught this place Saturday evening for quick meal. Promptly seated as a single. Good, friendly service. Had burger, fries and dessert - delicious. Waitress made a fresh pot of coffee for my request. Will return next time I'm in town

The food and drink was on point. Everything was flavorful. I had the lamb flatbread and let me tell it was superb. The wait staff was very friendly hospitable,and attentive even though they had a large party going on. I would definitely recommend coming here for a bite.

While it may have been on the show, this is not a diner, a dive, or a drive in. It is a bit more upscale and the prices reflect it. We had the cigars and a plate of duck, prosciutto, corned beef, and cheese. The meats were all excellent. The cigars were good, but they didn't seem to have any of the Moroccan flavors I was expecting. I did enjoy the lighter color scheme and brighter atmosphere. It was refreshing after a week of dimly lit museums and restaurants...

This place was amazing! The CR burger was perfect and the flatbread was some of the best I've had. The place is quiet and relaxed and surprisingly even on a Saturday night it wasn't very busy. Definitely recommend!

Great place for either drinks or a meal, by yourself or with friends.  On a Friday night there wasn't a wait, but it isn't the biggest place so that might not always be the case.  They have an ok happy hour to get you started, but nothing that'll sustain you.  It's the usual rail drinks, select wine and beer.  They didn't have any food on the happy hour menu, that's always disappointing.  The waitress was really nice, and had lots to suggest for someone who hasn't been there before.  The Chicken Schnitzel was honestly one of the best chicken dishes I've had in a while.  Price wise, my part of the bill was $43 and included 2 happy hour drinks, 2 shared small plates, entree, and tip.  So the place isn't cheap but it isn't expensive either.  Overall, it was a pleasant surprise for a restaurant in NoMa and I'd go back, no issues.
Super friendly, great drinks. Would totally love to see a vegan item added to the menu!
Visited this place while in DC for business.  I got the CR Burger and fries.  It was good.  Service was good too.  I will be back
Fantastic!

I don’t drink alcohol and will often get mocktails when I go to a bar. I had previously been charged $4 for the mocktails, which was a little steep; however, last time I went they wanted to charge me $54 for 4 mocktails. This is completely unreasonable and ridiculous. The bartender offered me a discount but made it clear they will cost more moving forward because it is fresh juice. I could go to Whole Foods and buy a gallon of fresh juice for $12. Most bars charge $2-3 for a mocktail. Overpriced, total ripoff. Taking my business elsewhere.
Been twice.  Second time was great - highly recommend the rueben sandwich.  Fries are delicious.  Cool open air vibe.

The carving room has a great ambiance. Dark with candles in the evening that gives it a romantic feel. Our server and over all service was really good. The food portions seem to be a little on the smaller side except maybe the flat breads and pizza. I had the lamb, it didn't come with and sides. It was good and flavorful the meat was just a very fatty cut.
Good sandwiches and nice selection of beer on tap.
The food is incredibly fresh and tasty. Amazing dishes, try everything.
Great Lunch Spot

The food and drinks are quite tasty but a bit overpriced. The staff seem undertrained and struggle to accommodate, even when the restaurant is below half capacity. One example of a couple of odd choices made here: the hummus is very good, but despite being given an enormous portion, you are given a minor amount of bread to dip with. Hoping that a few things can be tweaked here. The food is delicious, and Carving Room makes a great addition to NoMa.
Fun space, friendly staff, good food and drinks.
Excellent wide open (yet cozy) space with quality food and amazing attentive wait staff. Def gonna make this a regular spot

I was in a bit of a quandry.   It was the last day of hosting a big group of relatives and we all wanted to go to a restaurant.  I had teenagers, adults, vegetarians and meat enthusiasts.  Then I remembered that Carving Room NOMA (I had been to the original Carving Room many times) had just opened.  It's such a pleasure to know that everyone can find something on the menu and to see smiles on everyone's faces (we have a very picky group).  The vegetarians were enchanted by the earthy beet puree (with fresh bread!!) and the impossibly light and smooth ricotta cheese with a touch of honey.  We also had a tender and flavorful carrot salad. They finished off with a beautiful fresh tomato flatbread.  The meat eaters had a ribeye flat bread with a Harissa drizzle (mmmm...), and a burger that was absolutely insane.  It was impressive with a fluffy fresh baked bun, onion jam and came with crispy hot cumin fries.  We also had an order of crispy spiced meat cigars (think exotic egg rolls) which I remember from the original restaurant.  I'm so glad they serve them here!  The service was friendy and attentive without being intrusive.  I liked that food came out as it was ready.  We were all able to talk and share bites.  The owners (Oded and Rachel) even came by to check on our food and and were really kind!  They took the time out to  give some cooking advice to one of our teenagers that had questions. They chatted about making all the homemade sauces and were just natural hosts.  We all left pleasantly full and satisfied.  I'll be coming back to try their cocktails!  It looks like a great place for a date.  The bar looks very inviting!
Sophisticated comfort food with an international twist. Feed the whole family, whatever they might enjoy. Open and airy yet comfortable and friendly.

Highly disappointed by this one.  I live in the neighborhood, and saw that this place had opened up while I was walking by one night. The place looked fantastic, with a great ambiance, a very nice looking bar, and plenty of patrons. So my fiance and I decided to try it for lunch one day. We soon regretted our decision.  Upon arrival, there was a line out the door. We feared that we had shown up too late, and had been beaten by the midday lunch rush. As we got closer, we saw that the line was due to a logjam at the main podium, as soon as you walk in the door. Nearly all of the tables were still open.  Now normally, I assume a place with this sort of setup will have you take a seat, and then place your order with a waiter/server. Here, this was not the case, hence the long line out the door into the heat. You place your order and pay at the front podium, and then get a table number along with your receipt, which the servers then have to run around searching for the right number. It's a highly inefficient process, only helped today by the fact that there were not too many patrons there all at once.  Ordering at the podium was a chore. The hostess, or more seemingly the system was inefficient. We ordered an entree for each of us, and it took nearly a whole two minutes of the hostess tapping away at the touchscreen just to get the first item entered in.  My fiance ordered a chicken schnitzel sandwich, and I went with the CR Burger, thinking it would be difficult to mess those up. Upon ordering, I came to the shocking realization that the listing prices on the menu ($13 for both entrees) did not include ANY sides. Fries were extra, and thus I did not order any.  We proceeded to our seats, and waited for our food to arrive. In the meantime, we had water at the table to keep us occupied. I did go up to the bar and ask the bartender for a refill of water and some lemon. It was no trouble at all, but he carried himself as if I had just asked a tremendous burden of him. Not a great impression of service.  Service was generally lacking the entire visit. No one checked up on us for refills of water, no one asked us how our food was, and no one came to clear anything from the table. Just generally felt incredibly isolated, and a very cold experience. I've had far superior customer service interactions at my worst visits to a place like Nando's, which follows a similar dining model.  As to how the food was, the burger was thoroughly okay. It was cooked a good medium, had decent flavor, and the special mayo was a nice touch. However, the patty itself was incredibly underwhelming in terms of size, especially considering the price for it. I would have been better served with a burger from Five Guys, and paid far less, or equal with a side of fries.  As for the chicken schnitzel, it was disgusting. The chicken was of obviously very poor quality. Very tough and difficult to chew. Seasoning was okay, but overall just inedible. My fiance ended up eating the sandwich without the chicken on it. We both tried a small bite of the chicken, and I know the servers were looking at us as we did, and we made disgusted faces, but did anyone come over to ask us how we were? Nope! They all stood in the back in a circle on their phones.  We will not be back here. Not only was the food disappointingly mediocre at best, but it was incredibly overpriced, and the staff clearly do not care about the quality of the product, or their patrons, and that's a damn shame. A place like this, but of true quality, is a place that this neighborhood could really use, which makes this just more disappointing.

Hopefully, it gets better but was charged extra for fries with the burger I ordered. The Happy Hour menu as of 6/20/2019 implied that the burger came with a choice or fries or salad. When the bill came, the waiter clarified that that wasn't the case. The waiter agreed that the menu was confusing.  The Happy Hour prices are not the best but aren't absurd either. If I go back, it will probably only go to drink in the future.  The rest of my party were very happy with the cocktails they ordered.  If you want a beer, I suggest going to Red Bear. If you want a burger, I suggest going up the few blocks to Five Guys.

Love the concept. Really want this to succeed. But it’s not there yet.  Food was fine, nothing special, and not worth the prices, especially with such small portions. Cocktail was watery. Nice plates and atmosphere.  Charging for extra bread is insulting.  Servers had a generally smarmy attitude and didn’t get our orders quite right, but that’s to be expected at a new place.  I’ll be back, maybe for happy hour when prices are more in line with quality and quantity, and will update my review if they fix their problems.
Great addition to the neighborhood! Loved the food and the space. Good place for happy hour and lunch or dinner. Try the hummus and the meatballs

Wonderful food, wonderful atmosphere, and wonderful service. Special thanks to the beautiful Stephanie who went out of her way to accommodate and was exceedingly helpful and knowledgeable about the menu. Will be back.

If you live in NoMa or are looking for an interesting restaurant with modern vibes and delicious food, CR NoMa is your place. A family owned and operated business bringing Mediterranean cuisine to another level! Definitely recommend to anyone in the DC Area!

The food was outstanding although the full menu was not available, looking forward to more. The atmosphere was especially the bar. The service was very kind to our party. Overall the experience was great, and I highly recommend!
CR Noma: Lovely atmosphere, artisan dishes, & a friendly place!
